In no time at all she is calling you over to one of the oddly shaped pods to which you sit down in. The door closes and it begins to hum to life with all sorts of similar buzzing noises to before. Then there is a flash and a whole new sensory pallet for you to adjust to. You look down, finding yourself dressed in a sleeveless cotton dress, green and covered with white floral prints. It shows off your bare shoulders and a quite supple set of legs. Among your bare shoulders is long blond hair which you can feel tingling mid-way down your back where the dress doesn't cover.

You stand up with a wobble and a shake but step out of the pod shaped device with at least a minor sense of relief. You have had nothing but a slim desire to be a woman up until now what with your experience limited only to a 70+ year old body. This younger one, despite being your mother's is nothing but a more delightful experience. Your breasts are quite perky and noticeably larger; albeit more visible with your current outfit.

Your mother is looking at you dejected with a groan of displeasure. Her whines are hushed by her own mother as she steps out of the machine and passed you, to snatch up your mother. "Let's go, Brian. Leave your mother alone." She says, dragging your mother out of the basement.

You take a moment to take in a bit more of yourself, finding that despite never once wishing to be your own mother and even finding the idea of finding her attractive disgusting, you are now in complete admiration of her body. Her curves still prominent, her skin still supple, her hair is long and smooth, the entire body is nothing short of superior to your previous female experience.

"Regardless, I still need to get my body back." You declare to your lonesome, a bit startled by your mother's smooth voice escaping into the room by your command. Your mother's voice has always irked you as it usually meant something negative but from this perspective the uncracked feminine voice is appealing and fun to use. "Maybe I'm just in utter relief but... I kind of like this." You state as you feel up your body's qualities in a way that seems more 'woman who is proud of her body' than 'perverted boy.'

Pleased with what little youth you garnered, you head upstairs...
112122222221.title: She got an 89, 1 point shy of an A-

choices: Try and get out of this.
1121222222211.content:
Only a few steps away from the basement door you run into your father who now embraces you as his wife. Still a bit excited to be in a more tolerable body, you don't fight it when he kisses you. The quick kiss feels strange enough but forced as it is, you don't particularly dislike it but do feel an underlying disturbance. Pulling away, you take notice of your mother peering out of the kitchen with eyes risen and mouth felled. You end up sending the wrong message to her as you begin to giggle from your father's continual stroking of your waist. Perhaps from disgust or alarm, your mother hurries out of the kitchen and upstairs to your room leaving only trails of confusion in her wake.

"What's wrong with him?" Your father asks as he tugs you close once again which forces you to place attention on him. "Not sure." You lie before he starts brushing your hair and kissing your neck. "Uh..." You hesitate on how to respond as his lips find their way back to your own, an unwelcome tongue pressing against your closed lips this time...
1121222222211.title: To your now husband.

choices: Ask grandma on how to live your mother's life.
11212222222112.content:
Not feeling the same thing as him, you gently push against his chest. An act that relieves you of his kiss but not the situation and as he looks at you a bit disappointed, you roll your eyes around the room looking for some excuse to leave. "Uhh... I promised Brian I'd help him study." You blurt out, displaying an awkward grin and risen brow that scream 'please believe it.' He appears skeptical and voices it as such... "Did he hit his head or something? He never asks us for help when it comes to school."

"Yeah, well... you know... things change, I guess." Your response carries little certainty and your actions do little to aid as your eyes would rather gaze at the plain white paint job than meet with his. He leans against you, cupping your butt cheeks with a cheesy grin and speaks only a breath away from your lips. "You have been rather frisky this week, I guess I got too used to it. One day off seems fair." The information sets in with a whispered disgust but it doesn't reach the outside as the sound simply converts into your father's body as his lips press against yours once more. One hand climbs up the back of your body until it's cupping the back of your neck. You don't fight his kiss, hoping that perhaps complete obedience will make it stop faster but as he leans against you even more, your breasts start to sting under his press, a bit of a pain but it relieves as he finally ends his aggressive action. "I'll let you get to studying then." He says before walking passed you, one loose hand gliding along the edge of your body as he walks by you.

His absence leaves you pressing against the wall, arms at full length and head drought, staring blindly at the floor and the framing blond hair. "Maybe this wasn't such a good idea..." You deem as you try to comprehend just how many times that same situation may come up. It leads to several thoughts, all of which are questions about how you're going to live your mother's life. "How am I going to manage her work? Hell, how am I going to get to her work; I don't know how to drive?" You ask yourself these questions in a soft whisper as you straighten your posture. You would much rather look like your mother than your grandmother but as far as life goes, being able to do whatever you want is far more appealing. An old body full of aches and pains or a middle-aged body with a lifestyle you can't possible play along with?

You know it's not a choice though as asking to change back would give your grandmother reason to lengthen this annoying process even more. You also don't want to be an old woman again, it was far from pleasant. "Who knows, maybe I'll even manage this life somehow." You reason as you take yourself upstairs, passing an eye over your room.
11212222222112.title: Try and get out of this.

choices: Ask your grandmother to help you out today as she has done it before.
Go alone and hope for the best.
112122222221121.content:
You're thoroughly irritated by both your grandmother and your mother but far more-so with the former. After-all, she is the reason this is happening and the one keeping your mother from telling the truth to Dad. With that thought in mind, you have little desire to come groveling to her for help and instead opt to enter your former room. You creek open the door and peer in but all that lies inside are the testy glare of a flustered boy. "What do you want?" She asks the moment your shoes touch the thin gray carpet. You close the door gently before attempting a response, a bit uncertain on how to go about a conversation.

You remain without words until she looks away, returning her attention back to her books, an activity you're happy to see her doing on her own. "So, how's the studying going?" You ask but it doesn't end up sparking a conversation like you had hoped as she promptly responds "Fine. I don't need your help." You may still be a child but even you know she is irritated about being hassled about her grades. "Well, good because that's not why I'm here." You state which peeks her interest slightly but before you can say anything else she speaks up... "Are you here to tell me you're in love with your own father?"

"What...?" You say off-key, thrown off from the random comment. You display "No!" with every part of your body, disgusted that even your own mother is thinking such things from your uncomfortable display from earlier. "He was forcing himself on me, it was gross but since you apparently have a secret to keep, I decided not to tell him." You inform her but she only looks back at you quizzically. "And the giggling?" She asks with a raising brow. "I'm ticklish." You answer quickly, wishing to put this scene behind you for good. The mounting discomfort seems to die off and the room itself becomes bit less tense as your mother's emotional state douses itself in cool water. "So what did you want?" She asks but it leaves you pondering if she actually believed you or not.

"Well, I definitely don't want to be a grandmother again but since I have to be you, I was wondering... how the hell do I do that? I can't drive and I sure as hell don't know how to do your job." The questions leads your mother to evaluate the safety of her own life. "I was put off enough by my mother living my life and now you..." She mumbles, loud enough to reach your ears but perhaps unintentional. "Well?" You ask as you seat yourself on the bed, a hand unconsciously lifting the straps of your bra, an embarrassing and newly acquired habit that only your mother takes notice of. She let's it go without a comment though and instead tries to answer your question. "You're not driving my car. Far as I'm concerned, this is all my mother's doing so she can drive you to and from work. How to do my job, hmm... I'm a Front Desk Clerk at the Nightlion Hotel..." After naming her workplace, your mother rambled off into a detailed explanation on what it is you should expect. You feel as though you understand but your stomach still clenches more than any test has ever plagued it.

"I think I get it." You state quietly despite your discontent. You leave the room with solemn steps, not pleased by what tomorrow entails or how skeptical your mother is about your ability to successfully be her. As you go to enter your new room, sadly shared with your father, Grandma passes you by, pressing you towards the bathroom. "Now, now, you can't go to sleep with all that makeup on." She says as she puts you in-front of the oval mirror above the decorative sink. It's ironic the same person who forces you to take off such things is the same person putting them on you the next morning after you've dressed in your mother's red and black uniform, pencil skirt sadly accompanying the outfit; a restraining piece of cloth you're not entirely fond of.

After being a grandmother and seeing your mother before and after having makeup on, you must admit it does wonders. She looks no more than 30 with it on. A fact which brings a brief smile as you look at your reflection, rather pleased with the way it turned out. "Shall we go?" Asks your grandmother after putting putting down the mascara. You have no desire but agree and reluctantly leave the house with her. With your mother already at school as your mother strangely works 10 to 6, you get no last words to perhaps remind you of what it is you're supposed to do.

In the car with the nerves piercing every opening of your pores, you...
112122222221121.title: Check up on your mother.

choices: He lets you off with a warning.
1121222222211212.content:
You begin to regret your decision the moment you waddle into the towering building, awkwardly taking yourself towards the front desk where another woman of a much younger age stands. "Oh, good, you're here Lindsey." Says the round-faced and seemingly bubbly girl from behind the desk. "Y-yeah." You reply as you take her place behind the desk. "See you tomorrow!" She hollers as she rushes off and out of the hotel at a blistering speed. Yet again, you wish you had asked for help and as the first person to enter the hotel comes, you only wish that more. It's a tall man with broad shoulders but little build, wearing a nice brown suit with striped cuffs. "Hello. I made a reservation; Martin Hindsburg." He says but seems to pay you little mind after the first glance as he rests his arm on the desk and looks in any direction other than your own. You don't say anything other than "Good day." before ravaging through the little booklet in front of you. You have no idea what you're looking for, his name supposedly which is something you do find and declare it to him. "Yes, here you are." However, you have no idea how to follow that up.

"W--what room number was it?" You ask him stupidly, as you continue to look into the book. He finally gives you attention but you don't really want it as he merely chuckles at your comment. "You tell me." He scoffs and continues to glance over things other than you. There are several numbers next to his name and after searching through the desk below for the keys, you eventually just hand him one with a number that was next to his name. "Enjoy your stay." You say, whether it is the right key, you have no idea.

You sigh the moment he leaves, running a hand through your styled hair which only loosely falls out of place from your touch. You gain no ground for relief however as the phone to your side begins to ring. You pick it up, spouting a line you only assume is correct... "Nightlion Hotel, how can I help you?"

"Hello, I'd like to reserve a room for one for Thursday to Monday." The woman over the line declares. "Um... let me see what we have." You say, scrambling to the booklet for information. After about a minute of finding no evidence on where room availabilities are, the impatience on the other side begins to swell. "Well?" She asks with an irritated tone, perhaps justified but that doesn't change your dislike of it. "One sec!" You holler back but after another fifteen second of no results she blurts out "Do you know what you're doing?" Becoming a bit unloose from the stress you reply in a truthful expression, hoping perhaps for some sympathy. "Not really."

"Can I speak with your manager because you're obviously a new employee or an idiot?" The comment makes you want to slam the phone down or yell at her but realizing you're hiding behind your mother's visage, you opt against it and instead concede to her wishes. "One moment." You say, placing the phone down at the desk before retrieving the manager; a room obvious enough to even be noticed by your own incompetence.

"Um... someone on the line wants to talk to you." You say after creaking open the door, revealing a man somewhat similar to the one from before only with a distinct mustache. "Alright." He says as he picks up the phone and with a simple change of lines, begins to speak with that devilish woman or so you have come to think of her. You can tell the conversation is not going in your favor as he looks up at you briefly every so often. This becomes fact when the phone clamps down with your mother's name soon following. "Lindsey, have a seat." The tone makes you fear the brief future and as you take yourself into the soft cushioning of the chair across his desk, he begins a looming stare. "I'm not sure what's wrong with you lately but considering the circumstances..."
1121222222211212.title: Go alone and hope for the best.

11212222222112121.content:
"...I think I'm going to have to let you go. You were fumbling over yourself last week as well, I can't afford more screw ups." He declares, a set of words you fear yourself too young to hear. Your heart pounds against your chest so fast it could pop your breasts free if you let it simmer. "What!? You can't-- Just give me another chance!" You plead, arms open wide and eyes both shocked but determined. He shakes his head however, leaving you to further digest the implications. "You can't!" You shout as you jump up from your seat, fists clenched. "Don't make a scene. Look, you're a beautiful woman and rather intelligent-- prior to this month. I'm sure you'll land on your feet." His words are reassuring at the very least and he certainly seems rather kind for a boss but it does little for your emotions. You wish to further defend yourself but instead turn around and leave.

Tears stain the mascara on your face as you pick out your phone to call your grandmother. You cannot believe you just got your mother fired from her job in a fraction of a day. "Hello?" Your hear your grandmother say. "I got fired!" You blubber into the phone, a surprising amount of depression clouding your vision. "What!? H--how?" She demands to know but you simply say "I just didn't know what I was-- was doing."

"I can't believe you got your mother fired!" She screams over the line, potent with ferocity but it only contaminates your mind as well. "Hey! This isn't my fau-- entirely my fault! He said 'I' screwed up last week so you weren't doing a good job either!" You remind her which seems to shut her up enough to disperse of the anger. "I'm coming to pick you up." She says and hangs up.

----

You arrive home and immediately your grandmother is reapplying makeup to your tear stained face. "What are you doing?" You ask, a bit confused by her priorities. "I told you in the car, we're going to look for a new job. I'll whip up a resume based on your mother's old one." She states, yet another thing you do not wish to partake in but now feel the responsibility to do so. "Where at?" You ask but she only shrugs and says "Anywhere with a similar or better salary."

"What about mom?" You question but as you suspected, your grandmother tells you to keep it a secret. You're hesitant to agree to such a lie as surely she'll notice when she returns to normal but for now you think it maybe best. After the resume is complete, you spend the rest of your 'work shift' applying for job positions, interviewing if given the opportunity straight away. You keep it simple and lie through your teeth but to be perfectly blunt, you feel you have better odds getting hired by some of the male manager's simply because they think your mother is hot; a vibe you definitely picked up from a few of them.

You arrive home about when your shift would have ended and are immediately greeted by your, perhaps eager to hear the results of your day as her. You feel uneasy immediately, even more so from her greeting. "Welcome back mom, how was work?" She asks with a curving gaze above her shifting neck.
11212222222112121.title: He fires you.

choices: You get the job at the hotel.
112122222221121212.content:
"Fine, I think it went well." You lie with a bashful smile and a hand gently brushing the length of your hair. "I helped her out." Your Grandma claims as she places her hands upon your shoulders. "That's embarrassing but I guess it's better than screwing up." Your mother deems after a humorous bit of shame rolls across her face in the form an awkward but brief smirk, a raising upper lip and a cringing nose.

"Since I was out as well, let's do take out for dinner." Your grandmother mentions as she passes by your mother, changing the subject quite skillfully. "That sounds good to me. I'm starving." Your mother adds as she follows after her own mother. Left behind, you release your emotions in a long sigh and lean yourself against the shut door. You can't believe you're thinking it but you're happy you're not returning to your own body for at least a few days as you know you need the time to fix your mother's life. You know she'll never forgive you but if you somehow manage to get a job that pays even a little more, perhaps you'll get off the hook.

You push away from the door only to be pressed against the chest of your father. "Finally back, Lindsey?" He says only as an opener so he can kiss you. You get it over with quickly and modestly push yourself away from him. "Yeah, it was a long day. The clock just didn't move, I'm tired." You make an excuse far before you have to lay beside him in bed, perhaps you're getting good at being a wife? You don't care if you disappoint him as you have much more dire things to worry about; the current being about food as you're also starving.

The family opts for pizza, simple and delicious so you don't mind. What you do mind however is the random question your mother asks you during dinner. "Oh, hey Mom. Is it alright if I sleep over Justin's house tomorrow?" You're hesitant to let your mother spend time with your friends and at the same time sleep anywhere near another boy. She may end up making you gay or something but considering you've already let your father go to 1st base does that even matter now? Still, considering what you have done to her life, you agree without hesitation. "Sure." You say with a bright smile.

Taking the kindness as an opportunity, your sister Jennifer pops a similar request. "Oh! Can I sleep over Heather's house then, Mom?"

"Sure." You say in the same manner, a subtle crack coming from your father post-response. "Pushover..." He says with a chuckle. "Quiet, you." You bark back with a brief chuckle of your own.

--

The next morning after everyone but your grandmother have dispersed you begin to receive some calls from a few of the places you applied at. There is only one other hotel within a decent driving distance and you pray you can get work there as all the other places were not something a 40+ year old woman should be doing and minimum wage applied to a lot of them.
112122222221121212.title: Lie for now.

choices: She notices the different logo on the suit.
1121222222211212121.content:
"Really!?" You exclaim after hearing the good news, a flush of relief rushing over yourself like a cool drip of water has just doused the flames around your body. "Yes, you start on Monday next week. We'll need you to come in and get fitted for your uniform as well as familiarize yourself with the Hotel." The boyish man over the line says, his voice despite sounding childish now brings a saintlike hymn to your ears. "Thank you so much! I'll be down there soon." You say, clutching the phone as if a dear friend. "You're welcome. Have a nice day." The voice responds before hanging up the line. Despite the absence of his ears you still shout "You too!"

"Sounds like good news." Your Grandma comments as she watches you slowly slide down the wall with a smile of relief. You climb up the wall and nod as your relieved smile fades behind the nervous expression that takes precedence. "Yeah, I start Monday so I have today, tomorrow and Sunday to get used to that place so I don't screw up again." You state as you guide her towards the exit of your home. "Let's get going." You say.

You took notice of it yesterday but as you walk up to the Double-Tree Hotel for a second time, you really do find it to be much smaller than the Nightlion. Regardless, the pay is almost identical but that could be because the rooms are generally nicer even if less in quantity. You don't feel the same sense of dread that the Nightlion produced but as you step inside, you become definite in your nervousness. "Hello, what can I do for you?" A tall woman behind the front desk asks. She's dressed in what you assume to be what you will be wearing; a similar outfit only instead of red and black it's a strictly white dress suit.

"Hi, I'm Lindsay, I'm going to be working here starting Monday. I want to get used to it before I do and I need to get fitted for a suit." You inform her which quickly brings some life to her otherwise dead face. "Oh! Nice to meet you, I'm Janice Monthwellin." She greets with an open hand waiting for your grip which it does obtain. "Lindsey Carmichael, nice to meet you." You reply with a smile brighter than your actual enthusiasm. Once both your hands return to their sides, she points you in the direction of the manager who you only met briefly yesterday for your interview. "Thank you." You say before following her directions.

"Good morning Lindsey." Carl, the manager and owner of the boyish voice says immediately after you enter. "Morning. Thanks again for the job." You say as you take a seat. "It's my pleasure. Anything you need to know?" He asks you quite softly, his head resting on his cupped hands. You can think of a million things to ask but in favor of your mother, you decide not to sound like a complete idiot. "About the suit..." You mention which is all it takes for him to start speaking on the subject.

"Ah, that. I'll give you an address for where you can get that taken care of." He informs you and after a moment hands you a piece of paper with said address on it. "If there's nothing else you need to ask me, feel free to go familiarize yourself with the hotel." He says, lifting himself from the chair and reaching a hand out to you. "Thank you, I will." You respond after taking his grip which is very gentle, though his thumb seems to be rubbing the outside of your hand a bit too familiarly.

--

"I hope you don't mind if I ask a lot of stupid questions." You tell Janice as you return to the front desk, this time hoping to get some practice before your actual job. You do end up asking quite a large amount of questions, enough to have Janice quiz your experience. It may make your mother look less competent but you definitely feel like you have a much better understanding of how to do the job, enough to make your stomach not feel like exploding.

It's not until Sunday when your mother returns from school after staying the night at Justin's house that you become nervous once again as she notices you carrying in the new suit, a much different logo displayed on the front of the outfit. "What's with the suit, mom?" She asks you slowly nudge your hand over the logo. "A color change at work." You reply very swiftly, wearing an unbelievable smile. "What? That's stupid, everything at the Nightlion goes well with the red and black. That's going to look out of place." She states to which you nod in agreement to, hoping she may just let it drop there...
1121222222211212121.title: You get the job at the hotel.

choices: Ask your grandmother about it first.
Ask your mother how she's been doing on her tests.
11212222222112121212.content:
She eyes you curiously, her lips tucked together with questioning intent but it passes by without any conflict as she shrugs and walks off. You breath a sigh of relief, knowing well that school will keep her curiosity busy enough.

--

You're just as nervous as you were the first time but after spending three days around the front desk, bothering whoever was working during those days, you feel much more confident. It appears to pay off too as you do everything pretty well throughout the day, experiencing pretty much all forms of the job in one day. Letting people checkout, taking reservations and on-the-spot calls, it all went well as you got to do them a few times as experiments thanks to your fellow co-workers during those three days.

Before you realize it, the school week has passed by, a fact which sets in beginning at the dinner table on Friday. "How was work, Mom?" Your mother asks only between her gorging activities. "Fine." You answer, a bit dull and while a typical response of your teenage-self-- to be honest you want to share more of the details but you also realize you can't do that in-front of Mom. "How's school you two?" You ask, simply out of habit at this point.

"Fine." Mom replies, whether it's to mimic you or her actual response, you can't be sure. Your sister however, goes on a tangent on a bunch of things you could careless about, as is her typical behavior. As you look around the dinner table and then down at yourself, you begin to feel as though everything is normal, a fact which is frightening in its error. This sits in further as you're in the bathroom taking your makeup off. You stand staring at yourself in the mirror thinking your mother is actually really beautiful, perhaps seeing her more as a woman than your own mother now. That thought quickly leads to another, one which makes your mouth go agape just so slightly. "I've been my own mother for a little over a week." You realize, which leads you to discern that between the time you've been your grandmother and mother, your mother has been you for about three weeks. The three weeks out of your own life actually make the thought of returning to it somewhat of an uneasy idea. You haven't even thought about turning back since you've become your mother as you have been far too concerned about getting her life back on track. You feel somewhat comfortable at work now and ironically... as your mother. The only discomfort you get is from your father but you have to think of avoiding him as a game.

You exit the bathroom and look towards your old room. You peer inside, finding your grandmother in there lecturing your mother on several study habits (As she often has during this time). "Yeah, yeah Mom." Your mother says with a waving hand as she continues to gaze at the book on her desk. You walk away, not wanting to bring anything up or rather, you're too nervous to bring anything up. The moment you do, your mother will realize what you did to her job and even though you got her a new job, you know she'll be angry.

These thoughts stay around you even while you sleep and the next morning; your day off. While you're sitting on the couch watching T.V. your mother passes you by groggily and says "Good morning, Mom."

"Morning." You respond, watching her walk by, feeling the way she calls you 'Mom' so naturally now a bit distorted. Once she passes by, you look down at yourself and your black sleeveless blouse and dark tight jeans. Your hair is completely done and your makeup is all on without the help of your grandmother. You know this has gone on too long if everything feels so natural now but with the fear of your mother you...
11212222222112121212.title: She doesn't notice.

choices: Your mother comes to you telling she got two As.
112122222221121212121.content:
As soon as your grandmother wakes up, you bring her alone to ask her about the feeling. "What's wrong?" She asks, a bit confused on why you pulled her off. You stand there for a moment, your thumb gliding across the colored nails at the tips of your fingers. "Um... don't you think it's time Mom and me swapped back?" You ask with an uncertain gaze. Her expression quickly chills to a stern, disapproving glare with a nagging finger. "You got her fired and you want to switch back already? I think at least another week is necessary." She declares without any hesitation. She hit you where it hurts, the guilt from getting your mother fired and with that, you solemnly agree with a weak nod and walk off.

With being your mother somewhat natural this week, your mind tends to dabble into other subjects including switching back and while you don't hate your mother's life nearly as much as you would have expected, the longer you stay in it the more you feel foreign to your own life. You also begin to question just how your mother hasn't gotten two As in a row by now and as the week ends, marking a month your mother has been you...
112122222221121212121.title: Ask your grandmother about it first.

1121222222211212121212.content:
After dinner on Friday, you walk into your old room and up to your mother who is laying on the bed listening to your iPod. "What's up?" She asks as she takes the ear pieces out, shadowing a curious glance of ignorance. A bit irritated by how comfortable she and you have become, you blurt it out.. "How haven't you gotten two A's yet?" Her mouth falls for but a moment before she recovers from the sudden question, looking away with an awkward smile which promptly fades once she answers. "Well, I kind of got two A's last week." She states, a furious piece of information to take in as you shout "What!?"

She shrugs and rolls her eyes. "I'm sorry but you seemed like you were enjoying it..." She mumbles and in a idiotic response you retort... "I wasn't enjoying it, I was just trying to make up for the fact that I got you fire--d..." You stop yourself and wish to seep into the new skin you wear as her eyes flash brightly for a moment. "Fired? You got me fired!?" She screams right after you close the door to shield the sound. You turn around with denying hands, flailing in your defense. "It wasn't entirely my fault. Your mother did a bad job at it to, my mistake was just the last straw." You deem but it does little to settle her down as she stands up from the bed, casting her arms up in irritation. "I can't believe this!" She exclaims but you jump once more to your defense.

"It's fine! I got a job at another hotel; I've been working there for two weeks. The pay is the same, it's nice." You reason but she only returns a fiery glare. "It's the Double-Tree isn't it?" She asks to which you clarify only to have her cringe in disgust. "I hate that place! God-- I can't believe this..." She rages but it siphons into you as you bark at her reaction. "It's not that bad! Look, I don't know what you've done with my life-- you could have screwed it up too and besides you never even told me we could have switched back a week ago!"

"I don't even want to switch back now!" She spits back at you, an insight into her mind you don't think she wanted you to know as she covers her mouth. Though you stumble from her words, you hurry to deny such an idea. "Well you have no choice, that's my life!" You declare but she denies that somehow. "The hell it is, Mom." She says with a cocky grin. "Stop calling me that!" You snap back at her but it only fuels the moment even more.

"Why not? Last I checked, I wasn't the 44 year old mother." She mentions with a sly smirk, leaving you only to further the situation into a downward spiral. You argue with her for an hour, progressively dulling in anger and as it reaches it's end with you and your mother merely staring at each other from across the room, she says "The school year ends in 2 months. You might as well let me finish it up."

You look at the clock where is she, she should be home by now and tired of waiting you go to your old bedroom for answers. As you enter you old bedroom it feels so foreign now having spent the almost two weeks sleeping in the guest bedroom, you searched for any sign of where your old body might be. Ruffling through papers on the desk you saw it, staring straight back at you, anger built; it was a test and the grade right on front it red pen was unmistakable it wasn’t just an A it was an A+. You grabbed the paper and went to find your grandma.

You heard her and your father’s voices behind the master bedroom door. You knocked

“Heather can I have a word” it still felt weird calling your mom by her first name.

“Be right there mom” but worse yet you hated hearing your mother’s voice calling you mom.

“What is it” she questioned standing in a red dress black nylons and heels?

“Why are you dressed up?”

“Frank’s taking me out he thought I needed a break after the long week. So what’s up mom” she smiled at you.

“This” you held out the paper.

“Where did you get this” she took it from your hands glancing at it.

“From my room it was hidden underneath a stack of papers on my desk.”

“I think we need to have a talk alone without your father overhearing, let’s go to the guest bedroom.”

You headed for the room you’ve been sleeping in for almost two weeks now while your grandma followed behind you closing the bedroom door upon you two entering the bedroom.

“Why don’t you have a seat?”

“Why?”

“Just sit down all right.”

“Fine so what are we going to do about mom” you sat your wide grandma bottom on the bed looking up at your mom’s body through the thick lenses you’ve grown accustomed to wearing.

“Nothing!”

Your heart sunk, your jaw dropped, you were speechless.

“I figured this might be easier for you to take sitting down, on the test that she had a 82 on I noticed a question she had wrong that she had to have known the answer it was so obvious even for me. So I questioned her that’s when she shocked me she said she didn’t want to go back to her life. You see your mom is at a crossroads you two are almost grown up so it’s like what’s her next step. Your father wants to have another kid before it’s too late, your mom doesn’t want that. She also doesn’t want the life she’s living right now working at her mundane job and coming home what most of the time is an empty house, with your father at work and her children no longer needing her, the children that will be out of the house in a few short years. Your mom wants more out of life, however the problem is she doesn’t have anything to fall back on to get her out of her mundane job, no college degree like all the companies want. She thought about going back to school but only going part time having to keep her job needing money for her schooling, yours, and your sisters plus the household bills, she said she’d be an old lady like me by the time she got done. However now that she had your body this was her chance and she knew it but that meant not getting an A, so she bombed her fist test and got a C, but she felt sick to her stomach doing it she wanted to do a little better yet couldn’t get an A so that’s what she settled for an 82. Of course I didn’t believe her and she told me about a test she didn’t tell you about and told me she’ll prove it; when she showed up with this it left little doubt in my mind that your mom was telling the truth, that every word she said was how she felt, I mean an A is one thing but an A+ 100%. However what shocked me about all of this was not that part that she wanted to be you; it was the part that she didn’t want her life. Ever since your grandpa died I’ve been like a zombie, I don’t know what to do, how to go on with myself, that’s why your mom asked me to move in so I wouldn’t be alone in that house and she wouldn’t be alone in hers. However that still didn’t help because seeing your father he reminded me so much of Walter and what I didn’t have anymore. So listening to your mom talk I could only think one thing how could she not want to have another child with that wonderful handsome man, how can she not want to do everything she possibly could for him, I would after just spending a week with him. That’s when I realized I could. I could give Frank what he wants and needs a child since I was now his wife and with your mom wanting to stay as you that meant I could stay as her and live her life. And I do say your father is ever the husband Walter was even more so in the bedroom. Now we just have one small problem to deal with.”

“I’m not staying as you no way I’ll find someone else to take this body, I don’t care who it is I’m not losing fifty some years of my life. Never grandma never! I’ll tell”

“Your dad,” she interrupted “go ahead first you’ll have to get him to believe you otherwise the nut house for you is that what you want.”

“He’ll believe me.”

“And if he does, guess what I broke the machine, it’s not going to work and I’m not going to tell what part I broke. So you’ll still be stuck in that body regardless and with my powers of persuasion, I think I know how to push a scientific man’s buttons. Will be his little lab rats and if he’s mad about the machine well then he’ll just have to spend the next five years building a new one if he can replicate his plans, you know how scientists are they never keep anything organized. Plus he’ll know who you are and there is no telling who he might tell, I mean this is the discovery of a lifetime. Do you want everyone to know who you really are?”

“Please grandma you can’t do this to me I can’t be you.”

“It’s the only way I mean from what I gather from your mom and from my experience in this house do you ever remember a time where no one raised their voice, no one argued, no one fought in almost two weeks. The reason is because everyone is happy.”

“I’m not!”

As Sarah and Bill walked down the hallway to her old room, they both worked hard at gaining back some of themselves. “I am sorry that the machine caused all these problems,” he said kinda in his right mind.

Sarah looked down at her father. “It’s okay, sweetie, you didn’t know it would happen,” she answered.

“Yes, but I built it in our basement. That was a bad idea looking back,” he answered. They entered the room as he continued. “I never wanted this,” he said gesturing at his body and then hers. “Now I’m stuck as a six year old and my daughter is my father.”

“Well, look at it this way. It is a unique experience. How many people can say they have been someone else?” Sarah replied with a response reflecting her new age as she helped her daddy take off his nightshirt.

“Ok, you are right on that, but a little girl should not be learning what it like to be her father. I feel bad that you are having to deal with my life, even if you have my memories to help out. In a way that just makes it worse. Liz or Mommy, sure doesn’t like it,” he reasoned.

Sarah smiled, “It is helping and it is rather scary knowing everything that you know. It’s weird that I feel like you are my daughter and having feeling for Liz, and not as her being mommy.”

“Yeah, I would imagine so. I just hope we can get back to normal before something more drastic happens,” Bill answered.

Sarah started to get nervous, she knew what Bill had meant by that. Bill saw that she was acting strange and asked, “Uh, why are you acting so odd?”

Sarah bit at her lower lip. “Umm, no reason,” she tried to lie.”

Even in his new body, he could tell that Sarah was hiding something. “Don’t lie to me, what happened?”

“It may be a little late to worry about something drastic,” she said nervously.

“What?” he continued to ask.

Sarah said down on the edge of the bed and took out a cigarette and lit it. Exhaling, she replied, “I’m not supposed to tell.”

Bill frowned, afraid of where this was going. “If mommy told you not to tell, then maybe you shouldn’t.”

“I’m not supposed to say anything to you about what we did,” Sarah answered not realizing she was giving away the secret.

“Did you and mommy do something?” Bill asked not really wanting to hear the answer.

Sarah took a deep drag and nodded. Bill knew the answer before he asked. “Did you and mommy do something only big people do?”

Sarah nervously smiled, “I didn’t want to.”

“Holy crap,” he said shocked. “I can’t believe Liz would do that knowing what happened. Is that why she is so upset?” he asked.

She nodded. “Mommy said she didn’t mean to, but it felt so good and she wanted to feel me inside her. I didn’t know what I was doing, but it did feel good to me too. Today I know what we did. I’m sorry daddy. I didn’t plan to have sex with Liz, but she is my wife right now and what we did was normal for mommies and daddies to do,” Sarah told him.

Bill wasn’t sure what to say. Part of him was angered at the whole situation and having put his daughter in that situation, but at the same time he was feeling that as the daughter he couldn’t argue with Sarah. “So you two made love?”

Sarah smiled at the memory of last night. “Ya, she started caressing my chest then she had me touch and suck her breasts while she played with my penis. Then she had my touch her vagina until she became wet and horny. It felt incredible having my penis inside of her. Kissing on her breasts, feeling her ride me,” she answered without thinking.

“SARAH!” Bill said startled, “that’s’ not a topic that one should be sharing with me.”

“Sorry, but you asked,” she stated, “besides you didn’t have a problem with telling me to call it a penis yesterday.”

Bill rolled his eyes, “Yes, but that was when we were talking about how to use it to go to the bathroom. I didn’t expect you would use it for other means and I sure hadn’t expected you to have sex and do all that other stuff. I don’t need to be reminded of what I’m missing.”

Sarah took another drag and then flicked the ashes into her open hand. “I know but I wanted to tell you what happened. Mommy just said I could not say anything.”

Bill sighed, “Ok. Well, now it’s out there and I know. So, we shouldn’t tell mommy that you told me.”

“Oh man, more secrets,” Sarah whined.

Bill smiled at that, “You know how she is already, just imagine how she will react if you mention that you told me.”

“Your right. So you aren’t mad that we had sex?” Sarah asked.

“Well, I’m not happy, but it is what it is. Just....if you do it any more don’t tell me. I don’t need to hear about it.”

Sarah got up and excused herself to go put out her cigarette. A few moments later she returned and helped Bill finish getting dressed in one of her old outfits. Dressed they both returned to the kitchen.

Nodding, Jim continued, “Well, that is interesting. You are thinking of it as me. So, I can see why you’re nervous. I was rather dreading this meeting.”

“Its all that I seem to be thinking about at the moment. I feel more in touch with being you today than last night. Its rather disconcerting about my new feelings toward Mark too. I’ve become sexually attracted to him.” Sarah said.

“Oh, well I guess that would be expected with my memories invading your head. I guess you’ll have to figure out what to do with that yourself. I did tell you to do what ever with while you are me,” Jim answered knowing what that could mean.

Yah, I...we have talked about it already. We kinda may have done something, sorry,” Sarah said sheepishly.

Jim eyes widened as that sunk in. “Well, I hadn’t expected IT to happen so soon,” sighing he continued, “but technically you two aren’t physically siblings anymore, so I suppose you shouldn’t fret.”

“I am sorry, it just kinda happened. The hormones kinda took over. I don’t know do you deal with it. I wouldn’t dare say anything to my real mom, but I feel I can talk with you about it since it is your old body,” Sarah replied lighting up another cigarette out of nervousness.

Jim nodded, “Well, now you know why parents are so concerned about their kids having sex at such a young age. Hormones will make you do stupid things. At least you won’t have to worry about getting anyone pregnant. That problem was fixed years ago.”

“Yeah, I know, I remember getting snipped. Just like I remember getting mom pregnant and being present when each of us kids were born,” she said with an involuntary shudder. Sarah saw her dad watching her with a look that she realized was just as she had been worried about. “You’re having mental withdrawals aren’t you,” she asked.

“Yes, I know you don’t smoke but in here, I still do,” Jim said tapping his head.

Sarah confided, “I was afraid of that. When I woke up this morning I was craving a smoke real bad and it wasn’t a physical one, it was mental. It got me to wondering how you were doing. With your memories now in my head, it makes me a smoker for over 20 years. I knew you did and I was likely going to have to do it to pretend to be you, I just didn’t expect this kind of sensation about it when we swapped yesterday, but I’ve got your addiction to it now. Since we are having an honest father daughter talk here, I should mention that I always wondered what it was like to smoke. I’m scared to admit it, but I’m really enjoying it, but I wouldn’t say anything about that to mom, the real one, she wouldn’t be happy at all. I want to help you out, but you don’t smoke now and it would most likely make you sick if you were to try.”

Jim giggled with his new voice, “Who would ever have thought our little talk would be with you as the father and me as your daughter. Now that you brought it up, I do have that memory. Your new habit may become a problem when we switch back and I agree about not saying anything to the real Liz. I didn’t expect you were going to become so comfortable with it when we switched yesterday.

Sarah looked around making sure they were alone, “So you have my curiosity about it now. I guess you know some of my, your friends are doing it, thats why I was curious.”

Jim blushed, “Yes. I know.”

“I can’t believe I’m even thinking of doing this, but here, if you want to try it.” Sarah said holding out the cigarette she had.

Jim mouth fell open, “Are you serious, I can’t.”

“Since I’m you, as your father, my mind tells me I would prefer it be here and now rather than sneaking around. I would rather my daughter be honest with me. At least we would both know.” Sarah answered truthfully. “Since you have to shower before you get dressed, it would at least keep the others from finding out.”

Jim was taken back. He was starting to behave more as his daughter as they had been talking. “Man, you really are thinking like me. It’s, like, exactly what I would have said. You’re sure about this.” His hand was trembling as he reached out to take it from Sarah’s hand.

Sarah took a deep breath, “Yes, I think so.”

Even having smoked for years himself, Jim tentatively held the lit cigarette and brought it to his lips. He tried to take a deep drag as he would normally do and immediately started coughing; his fourteen year old lungs not used to that. He waited a moment before trying a lesser inhale. The results were the same. “Okay, I believe thats all I need of that for now,” he said handing it back to Sarah.

Sarah felt a weird sensation of fatherly pride from the fact that Jim hadn’t liked it. As they had been talking she had starting to think more like a father, than herself. A thought that at least his daughter wouldn’t take up smoking in the future ran through her mind. “Well, now you know what it’s like, honey, and I hope you don’t start this habit. It’s not easy to quit,” she stated more sternly than she intended, her answer mirroring the thought in her head.

Jim detected the stern tone to Sarah’s statement. “I hope your not mad at me, Daddy,” he replied feeling more like a child being disciplined, “I never thought I would say it, but that was horrible and disgusting. Believe me, as long as I’m you, I won’t do that again.”

“Good, I’m glad to hear that. This will be our little secret, just father to daughter. Man, isn’t this ironic, me teaching you a lesson in life,” Sarah said smiling, lightening the tone.

“Yes, it is. Okay, so like, I’m sorry you have to deal with my meeting. I had forgot about with all the excitement going on yesterday,” Jim replied, his speech patterns becoming more like Sarah's as he changed the conversation.

“It’s okay, I’ll deal with it. I haven’t mentioned how stressed I feel about it to Liz, the new Liz,” Sarah said. “It’s so confusing trying to keep correcting names.”

Jim smiled, “Remember we are supposed to refer to each other as who we are, not who we were.”

“I know and I’m trying. I told...your mom, the same thing a short time ago. Okay, well you need to get dressed. Mom is fixing you breakfast. See you in the kitchen shortly, sweat-pea,” Sarah said with a grin at using the same pet name that her dad used on her.

“Okay, Daddy,” Jim answered.
1532111112211211211211112.title: Stay with Sarah

15321111122112112112111121.content:
Sarah left her old room. She stepped into the guest bath and washed the ashes she had been holding from her hand and flushed her cigarette. She paused at Mark’s door and started to knock before she heard movement from inside. Mark was always an early riser, seems mom got that habit from him, she thought as she continued to the kitchen.

Mark was finishing up on breakfast preparation when he heard footsteps. He had struggled at first when he started fixing the food, but like the others, everything he was doing was changing his behavior to become more like Liz. Turning he saw Sarah walk in. “Ready to eat, dear?” he asked feeling that was the correct thing to say.

“Absolutely, I’m starving,” Sarah answered as she poured herself a cup of coffee out of habit. She sat down at the table and started serving herself.

“It seems to take you awhile to get ready for work,” Mark commented.

Sarah swallowed her mouthful of food. Making sure to talk as her father she said, “Yeah, I made sure the kids were up before coming. I took a little longer than planned with Sarah, we, I, wanted to talk with her privately.”

Mark cocked his head quizzically, “Private talk. About what?”

Sarah thought back over what had happened just moments ago, “Well, she was having a little adjustment problems, kinda like we did. She also wanted to make sure I knew about the meeting today and everything.”

“Okay, so they’re both up?” he asked.

“Yes,” Sarah answered continuing to eat.

Just then Liz walked in. “Morning kids, sorry, Mom, Dad.”

Sarah looked over at her former mother. She was dressed in clothes just as Mark normally wore. “How did you sleep?”

Liz shrugged, “Okay, I guess. Little weird waking up before remembering what was going on.”

Mark had grabbed a glass and filled it with juice and sat it down in front of Liz. “Your, uh, father and I, had the same feelings. It’s rather odd waking up next to someone when your not used to it and having to get around in front of them,” he said as he gently stroked the shoulders of Sarah.

Liz caught that motion and felt uncomfortable. Her kids were behaving just as a married couple would. “I would imagine so, two kids having to pretend to be married and being in the opposite sex on top of it. Probably makes it uncomfortable being around each other,” she answered hoping her innuendo about them being married and sleeping in the same room would make them uncomfortable too.

Mark, feeling more in tune with his role, now that he had been up for a while, realized what his mom was trying to get at. He did still feel uncomfortable about it, but wasn’t going to let his mom see it. His mother’s habit of trying to mediate and being sure of her comments were coming through replied, “Well, it wasn’t that bad. We should be just fine. I think your father and I will work through it,” he stated as he leaned down and gave Sarah a kiss on the cheek.

Liz was irritated inside and now that she was in Mark’s body she was getting his temper and smart mouth. She knew what Mark was up to and without thinking it through blurted out, “Well I changed my mind and I don’t think you need to sleep in the same room. You aren’t ready for that kind of responsibility.”

Sarah had been listening to the banter back and forth between the two of them. Like Mark she wanted to play it cool, but Jim had a tendency to speak without thinking and snapped, “Well, it doesn’t matter what you think, young man. You and Sarah will not be sleeping together. Your mother and I will be staying in the same room and if we have a desire to do more again, thats our choice.”

“More! Again! My God, you two had sex? What were you thinking, your siblings!” Liz yelled.

Mark seeing this was going downhill, put his hand to Sarah’s mouth before she could answer. “Mark, we were siblings, but right now we are married. As long as I’m in this body I’m not a blood relative of your father. Now I can understand your concern, but there is nothing that can be done about it. I love your father and he loves me,” Mark stated going back to caressing Sarah’s shoulder.

Liz was shocked. Her kids had just admitted having sex as a couple, as her and Jim. She was seething as she tried to figure what to say next.

Jim had been coming down the hall and heard the yelling. “What is going on in here?”

Liz turned to her former spouse. “They just admitted they are having sex together, together!”

Jim having already known about it said, “What do you want me to do? They’re, like married, they can do that.”

“They’re our children, for god sakes!” she said angrily.

“No, they were our children. They’re not the siblings right now, we are. Like, we did give them permission to be like us,” Jim replied calmly.

“I regret that now. I didn’t expect them to do that.” Liz answered still upset.

“You know how I feel about you as, like Jim and how you feel towards me and stuff. You know, so what did you expect them to do? They’re, you know, just behaving as we would. I know that, Sarah now feels the way I do about you and Mark has your feelings for like me and stuff. I’m not comfortable with it, but they if they had sex then so be it.

“And how do you know what they are feeling, they are teenagers? They aren’t us.” Liz snarled.

Jim shrugged his shoulders, “Well, like me and Sar...I mean dad talked a while ago. He told me what he was feeling.”

Liz shook her head in disbelief. “You knew, were you planning to tell me? And why are you referring to our daughter as a male?”

Mark spoke up, “We agreed last night that we were going to have to speak to each other as who we appear to be. So she was correct in addressing your father as him.

“All of you are going nuts. Just because I may be thinking and acting like you Mark, doesn’t mean I have to. I’m still Liz!” she snapped back.

Sarah had heard enough. Her father’s anger came out even more. “Mark, I heard about enough from you young man. You’re stuck in that body for the rest of the week and you had better damn well starting acting like my son. If anyone outside of our little group here was to find out what happened, there would be consequences that none of us would want. Whether you like what has happened or not, I am in charge as is Mark. We ARE your parents right now. If you two hadn’t messed with the machine we wouldn’t be here most likely, but it did. Those memories that you are getting of Mark’s life are there to help you pull this off and I don’t see them going away until we switch back. I’m not liking it either, but if I’m going to have to be Jim then I’m going to act like it. Your sister is correct. I do have feeling for Mark, but they are the feelings of a man married to his wife. I can’t stop them so I might as well go with them and if that means having an intimate relation with her then by God I’ll deal with it. I don’t need this shit. I’m dealing with enough learning how to be the man of the house.”

Liz sat there speechless. As she looked at the others she realized she was outnumbered. Her kids were acting more like adults than yesterday and she noticed Jim was even starting to act and speak like Sarah. Everyone else might be willing to do this but she wasn’t. It had been an accident that her and Mark had been in and she regretted that, but having bought into suggesting her husband and daughter do it willing was stressing. Liz knew what they all wanted to hear, so she said it to placate them, “Fine, I’ll shut up and play along.”

Mark smiled in relief. “Good now have some breakfast before you have to go to football practice and Sarah, you need to eat to. You don’t want to get sick when you are at soccer practice.”

Jim and Liz looked at each other with a feeling of dread as they realized they were going to have to attend their kids activities. Jim smiled nervously. “Do you, you know, think that’s a smart thing to do,” he asked his daughter’s teenage speech continuing to become more pronounced.

Mark tried to give a reassuring smile as he fix each of them a plate. “We have to keep up the appearance that everything is normal. I would imagine as you start participating the memories of what to do will come to you, just as they have for your father and I. Your already starting to act like us now, whether you know it or not.”

Jim felt better as he thought about having to go to Sarah’s practice and memories of how she played came to him. By the time he finished eating, he was actually looking forward to going.

Liz on the other hand had memories of plays and roles that Mark had in his position on the football team, but she tried to suppress them.

Sarah had finished and grabbed her father’s briefcase and was starting to the door. “Okay, well here goes nothing. Mark, Sarah, have a good day and try to enjoy the liberties of being kids again. Liz, I’ll see you tonight,” she said giving Mark a quick kiss.

The swapping feature was just doing it’s job of making the participants more accepting to their new lives. She continued to calculate the connotations of what that would do to them. Sarah reached a conclusion that while they would continue to become more like the person whose life they had inherited, the machine wouldn’t allow them to lose themselves or at least she hoped.

Pulling into the private office that Jim worked at, Sarah quickly changed thoughts to that of the meeting coming in a couple of hours. She stopped outside and had a couple of cigarettes then headed to Jim’s office and started working on getting everything ready.

Back at home, Jim and Liz had finished eating and left for their practices. Mark had cleaned up the kitchen and had started getting ready for the day. He was still rattled by the heated conversation that had happened. While Liz had a good point, Sarah and Jim’s counter-argument was valid. They had only acted on the feelings that had came with the personalities, as much as he would like to try suppressing them he realized he couldn’t. He was living out his mother’s desires and they were just to strong. Still he noticed that everyone’s, whether they realized it or not, personalities had changed to match their new roles. Sarah and Liz having been the worst. Liz had behaved much as he would have, brash and argumentative, while Sarah had lost her temper like Jim and Jim had become unassuming and quiet in his speech. He, himself had taken on his mother’s role of being a moderator trying to keep things calm, but even so he had become irritated by Liz’s behavior. It was disturbing to see how he acted from someone else’s perspective. It was a trait he decided he would have to fix when things returned to normal.

As he showered and shaved, his behaviors started mimicking his mother’s. He remembered the dinner party that they had been invited to yesterday. His mind started to go through what he was going to need for the meal he had agreed to bring. Working on his hair and makeup he started making a mental list for the grocery store.

After finally getting through his mother’s morning routine of getting ready for the day, he grabbed her purse and headed to the grocery store. Just as with earlier today the more he followed her behaviors and routine the more in tuned he became with his role. By the time he had returned home, he was becoming more comfortable with his role as wife and mother.

Unknown to him was that so were the others. Liz and Jim, having been forced to act as the kids had found themselves behaving like their new roles though, Liz was still fighting it. Sarah too, having to immerse herself into her father’s work was finding it easier to act as Jim.

153211111222.content:
Sarah came upstairs looking for the rest of her family. Not seeing anyone in the living room she heard noises coming from the kitchen. She walked in and saw her mother’s body standing at the sink.

“Uh, bro, what are you doing? Where mom and dad?” she asked.

Mark turned surprised at the voice behind him. “Oh! Sorry you startled me. This is going to take some getting used to. I was fixing me something to drink, would you like something too? I think they are still in our rooms trying to adjust to this,” Mark replied, gesturing at his own changed body.

“Oh, okay. So what are you drinking?” she asked.

“Just some tea,” he answered.

Sarah nodded, “Sure that would be fine. I going to step out back.”

Sarah went out to the back porch and sat down. She was starting to become unsure of what they had all done and was trying to figure out what she was going to do.

Mark came out and sat in a chair next to her and placed their glasses on the table. “So you look puzzled. What’s wrong?”

“I’m starting to question if we did the right thing here. You and mom didn’t have a choice but daddy and I did and we still went ahead. I don’t know the first thing about being an adult and in charge of a household, more over I don’t know how to do my newly acquired job. Daddy tried to explain it to me, but it’s just so much,” Sarah stated, reaching in her pocket and pulling out a cigarette and lighting up, taking a deep drag.

Mark was surprised at his sister smoking and how easily she did it. “Wow, you seem to be jumping right in with smoking. You're having no trouble with that cigarette at all.”

Sarah looked at the cigarette in her hand. “No, I’m not. Thanks to my new habit now, I suppose. I’m rather embarrassed to admit it, but I am enjoying it. It just seems second nature to me. Just another bizarre thing to get used to. I am now a pack a day smoker thanks to daddy,” she answered taking another drag.

“Well I'm sorry you got stuck with it. I suppose you could quit," Mark suggested.

Sarah shrugged, "I could, but I don't see that happening in a week. I am too hooked on them or I should say, daddy is hooked on them."

"I guess your right. Uh, look, about the other thing, I don’t think it will be as bad as you think. Mom and Dad here to help out if we need it and it’s just for a week. We’ll all get through it together,” Mark replied trying to sound confident.

“So your not worried?” she asked.

Mark shook his head, “Oh I am thinking about it and it has me concerned too. Mom told me to just do whatever I need to and basically gave me a free pass to just.....be her.”

“Daddy gave me the same speech, whatever that means. I am already smoking like him, what more could happen to make it worse,” Sarah commented.

“Uh, yea. I don’t know if dad said anything to you, but mom was pushing for us to experience married life to the fullest. Though I’m not sure about that,” Mark stated taking a drink of his tea trying to hide his face blushing at the thought as he looked at his father’s body. His nipples started to poke out of his blouse.

Sarah’s eyes widened as she looked at her brother in surprise. “Ewwww. Are you saying she was telling you to have sex....with me....us. Holy shit.”

Mark was nodding, “Yes, that was my reaction also. I can’t have sex with you. That’s just weird and I told her so, but she just smiled and said we’ll see. She seems to think since we are now in their bodies that we will want to do it. She was saying you were no longer my sister, you are my husband and married people feel different toward each other.”

“I don’t think so,” Sarah said glancing at her mother’s body, “not that you, or mom, isn’t a beautiful woman, but I am not attracted to her in that way.” Sarah shifted uncomfortably as the thought of sex prompted a automatic response from her body.

“Yea, that’s what I thought too.” Mark said suddenly uncomfortable with the conversation. His own body starting to react on it's own. “I guess I should go try to fix something for dinner, now that it’s my job.” He got up, grabbing his glass and went back inside.

Sarah sat there sipping on her tea for awhile trying to get the thought out of her head as she lit up another cigarette. She shook her head as she realized she really was starting to enjoy her newly acquired addiction. Thanks a lot dad, its’ going to be a long week, she thought to herself as she took another drag and looking at the cigarette in-between her fingers.

Sarah grew tired of sitting outside and came back in. Her mom and dad were sitting at the table and Mark had started on dinner and it was smelling delicious. Sarah’s appetite had changed as her body had. “It’s smelling good, bro,” she commented.

“Uh, thanks. It’s weird at first I was sure of what I was doing but it seems to be coming to me more easily as I go along,” Mark replied.

Jim spoke up, “You really shouldn’t refer to Mark as your brother. You need to try and get used to calling him by his new name.”

“Your....daughter is right,” Elizabeth chimed in, “we can’t mess up and do that in public.”

Sarah looked at them, “So we should refer to each other as who we now are, even when we are home?”

Jim nodded, “Yes. We already talked about it, remember. It will make it less likely to slip up if we just do it. It will become natural.”

Mark turned and agreed, “It’s makes sense. We can’t be addressing each other that way.”

“Okay. In that case, dinner smells good Liz,” Sarah said uncomfortable with the words.

“Thank you, dear,” Mark replied going back to fixing dinner.

Sarah pulled out a chair and sat down, “So how are you two dealing with this?”

Jim looked at Liz then back to Sarah, “Well, it’s different. I, uh, I wonder if it was right to do it.”

“Oh good, so Mark, I mean, Liz and I aren’t the only ones. I’ll admit I’m uncomfortable with being in charge, now that I’m the head of the family.”

Liz nodded. “I think you will both do fine. We’ll be here to help out when you need it,” she replied looking to her former husband, now sister.

Sarah debated on bringing up the topic but decided to just do it. “I am rather concerned that you would suggest that since we are now the parents that we should...should take full advantage of our marital status.”

Liz blushed at the comment, remembering her telling that to Mark. “Well, we did discuss that with each other,” she said, gesturing to Jim, “before it was suggested to ‘mom’. I wasn’t saying you had too, but if it....if you want or feel like it, then we were fine with it. Right Sarah?”

Jim nodded, “You two are now in a whole new situation, new life roles. You have our bodies and you may get the feelings that come with them. I agree that if you choose to try it, neither of us would be upset. You aren’t physically related to each other anymore, unlike Mark and I now. We are the brother and sister.”

Sarah shuddered, “Eww, you can’t be serious. It is still very gross to think about. I never even kissed anyone.”
